definitions.definition: put forward (someone or something) with approval as being suitable for a particular purpose or role.
examples: George had recommended some local architects
synonyms: put in a good word for
vouch for; informalplug "her former employer recommended her for the post"

definitions.definition: advise or suggest (something) as a course of action.
examples: some doctors recommend putting a board under the mattress
synonyms: propose "the committee recommended a cautious approach"

examples: you are strongly recommended to seek professional advice

definitions.definition: make (someone or something) appealing or desirable.
examples: the house had much to recommend it
synonyms: give an advantage to; informalhave going for one "there was little to recommend her"

definitions.definition: commend or entrust someone or something to (someone).
examples: I devoutly recommended my spirit to its maker
